application_instruction: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: San Francisco, CA, USA; New York, NY, USA
description:
Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (Google Ads, AdSense, Google Marketing Platform, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across Sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.

As Marketing Communications Manager, you will assess opportunities across events and audiences, develop and execute strategies, create messaging, bring industry research to market and build campaigns to drive growth and engagement. You are a strategic, creative and analytical leader who is able to break down problems and drive to solutions while determining positioning, naming, external communications, and activation strategies for the vertical. You’ll work with external content and events agencies and internal cross-functional teams to plan and execute a comprehensive program of outreach and education, event participation, project management with internal and external stakeholders, process innovation, reporting and analysis, and other project-based work.

Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in performance marketing, product marketing, or marketing communications.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in working closely with sales teams to support external SOV across industry events and thought leadership channels.
  • Ability to run detailed analyses of external positioning and messages, and develop strategic solution.
  • Strong leadership and interpersonal skills combined with outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
  • Solid understanding of the digital ads ecosystem, and ability to translate insights into thought leadership.
responsibilities:
• Develop positioning, messaging, and value proposition for Google’s marketing solutions for the retail and direct-to-consumer brands industry.
  • Design and execute multi-channel campaigns to drive client engagement.
  • Advocate event programs and partnering closely with internal executives and sales teams.
  • Advocate for product vision and best practices to customers via industry events, webinars and other external communications channels.
title: Marketing Communications Manager, Retail Ads
